solution_line_template: First find the number of students who went through breakups: {breakup_fraction} * {total_students} = <<{breakup_fraction}*{total_students}={students_with_breakups}>>{students_with_breakups} students

Then subtract that number from the total number: {total_students} students - {students_with_breakups} students = <<{total_students}-{students_with_breakups}={remaining_students_after_breakups}>>{remaining_students_after_breakups} students

Then divide that number by {no_show_denominator} to find the number of students who didn't show up to take the test: {remaining_students_after_breakups} students / {no_show_denominator} = <<{remaining_students_after_breakups}/{no_show_denominator}={students_no_show}>>{students_no_show} students

Then subtract the number of students who failed in each way from the total number to find the number who passed: {total_students} students - {students_with_breakups} students - {students_no_show} students - {failed_less_than_D} students = <<{total_students}-{students_with_breakups}-{students_no_show}-{failed_less_than_D}={students_passed}>>{students_passed} students
